16148.「マグナスよ 緊急の用件だ。\n 今から リッグを伴って\n スピンドル兵士長を:
This is Magnus, and it's urgent. I need you to
go with Rigg now and get Captain Spindle!

16150.「参謀である お前が 呼びにいけば\n スピンドルも あわてて 駆けつけるじゃろ:
If you, as the chief of staff, call out for
him, Spindle will rush over in a hurry. Now,
make your way there!

16152.「これで 人払いできたな。\n さて…… 相談というのは 他でもない。\n 例の:
Now we've got rid of people. Now... this
consultation is about something else. The
Gazbalan's Fang.

16153.「あれからも ヤツらの行方を追っているのだが\n まるで こちらの行動を予知して:
We have been tracking their whereabouts ever since, but as if predicting our actions, they have been able to outsmart our plans and cause
us nothing but more damage.

16154.「正直 考えたくはないのだが……\n わしは ガズバランの牙に情報を流す\n ス:
Frankly, I don't like to think about it, but I
suspect the existence of a spy who is passing
information to Gazbalan's Fang.

16155.「思えば 最初に 連中が現れたとき\n ヤツらは どうして お忍びで行われた\n:
And to think, when they first showed up, how
could they show up at the scene of a
surreptitious hunt?

16156.「あれが行われるのを 知り得たのは\n 狩りに参加したメンバーと\n ザマ烽火台:
Only the members of the hunt and Janga at Zama
Beacon knew it was going to take place.

16157.「その上で 前回の ヤツらを捕らえる作戦を\n 事前に 知っていた者となると\n:
And if they knew about our last plan to catch
them, then there's only so many of them...

16158.「そう。お前さんと ジャンガ以外の参加者。\n 参謀マグナス スピンドル兵士長\:
Yes. The participants other than you and Janga. Chief of Staff Magnus, Captain Spindle, and Kingsguard Rigg... these three are the
suspects.

16159.「<pc>よ。お前さんには ３人の中の\n 誰がスパイなのか 探りだすために\n:
<pc>. I need you to help me set a
trap to find out which of the three is the
spy.

16160.「これから わしは 狩りの参加メンバーを\n ギルザッド地方の南にある 狩人のほ:
I will now invite the members of the hunt to
the Hunter's Den, the innermost Hunter Rest
Area in the south of Gilzad Region.

16161.「理由は……急に 狩りがしたくなったとかで\n いいじゃろう。わしが 城から出る:
The reason could be... a sudden urge to hunt.
If I were to leave the castle, of course the
spy would have to do something.

16162.「お前さんは 先に 狩人の休憩所に\n 隠れていて スパイが判明したら\n 速や:
You are to hide in the Hunter Rest Area first
and seize the spy as soon as you discover him.

16163.「……危険な賭けであることは 承知の上。\n だが このまま 何もしないで 兵士:
I know it's a dangerous gamble. But I can't
stand the thought of doing nothing and letting
the soldiers suffer more damage.

16164.「頼む <pc>！\n わしの この作戦を手伝ってくれんか？: Please. Will you help me with this operation?

16165.「さすが <pc>は 話がわかるな。\n もし マグナスなんぞに打ち明けたら\n:
As expected of <pc>, he knows what
he's talking about. If I had confided in
Magnus, he would have stopped me for sure.

16166.「……っと そろそろ マグナスたちが\n スピンドルを連れて 戻ってくるはず。\:
Oh well, Magnus and the others should be back
soon with Spindle. You go on ahead!

16167.「その返事は うれしく思うが……\n どうやら お前さん \n 予定が いっぱい:
I'm glad to hear that, but it seems you have a
full schedule.

16168.「よし。作戦開始は しばらく待とう。\n お前さんは 早く 頼まれごとを\n 片:
Okay. Let's wait a while for the operation to
start. You, quickly, go and take care of that
favor I asked you to do.

16169.「グロスナー王。\n スピンドル兵士長は 自室にいませんでした。\n どうやら:
King Grossner. Captain Spindle was not in his
room. Apparently, he was out on a patrol.

16170.「どうしましょう？ \n 城下町のどこかには いるでしょうから\n 人を使って:
What should we do? Should we send someone to
look for him?

16171.「……ああ もういいぞ。\n とりあえず その件は 先送りだ。\n ご苦労だった:
Oh, that's enough. Let's put that behind us
for now. Thank you, Magnus.

16173.「今は タイミングではないということか。\n しかし わしは あきらめるつもりは:
So this is not the right time. But I have no
intention of giving up.

16174.「もし 気が変わったら すぐ わしに\n 声をかけてくれ。:
If you change your mind, call on me
immediately.

16175.「グロスナー王。\n スピンドル兵士長は 自室にいませんでした。\n どうやら:
King Grossner. Captain Spindle was not in his
room. Apparently, he was out on a patrol.

16176.「どうしましょう？ \n 城下町のどこかには いるでしょうから\n 人を使って:
What should we do? Should we send someone to
look for him?

16177.「……ああ もういいぞ。\n とりあえず その件は 先送りだ。\n ご苦労だった:
Oh, that's enough. Let's put that behind us
for now. Thank you, Magnus.

16179.「マグナスよ 緊急の用件だ。\n もう一度 リッグを伴って\n スピンドル兵士長:
This is Magnus. It's urgent. I need you to go
get Captain Spindle again, accompanied by
Rigg!

16181.「何か 文句でもあるのか？: You got a problem with me?

16184.「さて わしの前に顔を出したということは\n 例の作戦に 協力しようという気に\:
Now, the fact that you've come to my doorstep
indicates that you're willing to cooperate
with the operation, doesn't it?

16185.「参謀マグナス スピンドル兵士長 近衛兵リッグ\n この３人の中から スパイを見:
Magnus, the Chief of Staff, Captain Spindle, and Rigg, the Kingsguard, are the three men who are supposed to set up traps to find the
spy.

16186.「これから わしは 狩りがしたくなったと言って\n ３人を ギルザッド地方の南に:
I will now invite the three of them to the Hunter's Den in the south of Gilzad Region, at the far end of the Hunter's Rest Area, saying
that I want to hunt.

16187.「これに反応して 行動を起こすであろうスパイを\n 先に行って 隠れていた お前:
The arrangement is that the spy who would
react to this would be taken down quickly by
you, who has been hiding in the first place.

16188.「……危険な賭けであることは 承知の上。\n だが このまま 何もしないで 兵士:
I know it's a risky gamble. But I can't stand
the thought of more soldiers being harmed by
doing nothing.

16189.「頼む <pc>！\n わしの この作戦を手伝ってくれんか？: Please. Will you help me with this operation?

16190.「本気ですか グロスナー王！？\n このようなときに 魔物狩りに行かれるなど\n:
Are you serious, King Grossner? You can't be
in your right mind to go hunting monsters at a
time like this!

16191.「このようなとき だからこそじゃ！\n ガズバランの牙が 現れて以来\n わしの:
And at a time like this, that's precisely why!
Ever since Gazbalan's Fang showed up, I've
been under a lot of stress...

16192.「この辺りで 気晴らしをせんことには\n 心労で倒れてしまうわ！ そうなれば\n:
If we don't get some distractions around here,
we're gonna collapse from exhaustion! And
that's exactly what they'll want us to do!

16193.「御身の命が 狙われるかも知れぬときでも\n 魔物狩りを 行われようとは……\n:
To hunt monsters even when your life may be in
danger... Your Majesty is indeed a man with a
lot of guts.

16194.「兵士長！ あなたは 賛成するのですか？\n このバカげた提案に……。:
Captain! Are you in favor of this? This
ridiculous proposal...

16195.「リッグ！ 近衛である あなたからも\n 何か言ってやってください！:
Rigg! You, my Kingsguard, say something to him
too!

16196.「私は……どこへ行くことになっても\n ただ ひたすら 王の身を守ることに\n:
I...will only devote myself to protecting the
king wherever he goes.

16197.「ほれ 見たことか。\n 反対しているのは お前ひとりではないか！:
You see what I'm talking about? You are the
only one who is against it!

16200.そして そのまま 時が流れた……。: And just like that, time passed...

16201.「よし 着いたぞ！ 今回の狩りでは\n この洞穴を 集合場所にするとしよう！:
Okay, we're here! Let's use this cave as our
rendezvous point for this hunt!

16202.「さあ それでは 魔物狩りを……: So, let's go hunt some monsters...

16204.「まさか…… お前が 裏切り者だったとはな。: I never thought... you were a traitor.

16206.「我ら ガズバランの牙の目的は\n 堕落しきった ガートラント王家を打倒し \n:
The purpose of our Gazbalan's Fang is to
overthrow the corrupt Gartlant royal family
and restore the Ogre's rightful way of life...

16207.「このような 絶好の機会を\n 見逃すわけには いきませんなぁ。:
We can't afford to miss such a great
opportunity.

16208.「……フン。\n そのような妄言には つき合っておれん。\n <cs_pcher:
Hmph. I will not be entertained by such
delusions. <cs_pchero>! Seize him!

16209.「……なるほど。\n どうも おかしいと思っていたが\n まんまと ワナに かけ:
I see. I had been thinking that something was
wrong, but I was caught in a trap, wasn't I?

16210.「だが そんなもの 我がチカラで\n 打ち破ってくれるわ！！: But I will defeat them with my power!

16211.「なっ！？ スピンドルが 魔物に……？\n と とにかく まかせたぞ <cs_p:
What? Spindle turned into a monster...?
Anyway, you got it, <cs_pchero>!

16212.「ガートラントの華 スピンドルの超絶剣技\n 今こそ 魅せてくれようぞ！！:
Gartlant's flower, Spindle's superb
swordsmanship, now let's see it!

16213.「遅いぞ <cs_pchero>っ！\n あまり 年寄りに 無理させるでない！:
You're late, <cs_pchero>! Don't push the old
man too hard!

16214.「どうやら また 我が 華麗なる剣技で\n 切り刻まれたいようだな。:
It seems that you want to be cut to pieces
again by my brilliant swordsmanship.

16215.「……いいだろう。\n ガートラントの華 スピンドルの超絶剣技\n 何度でも 魅:
...All right. The flower of Gartlant,
Spindle's superb swordsmanship, I will charm
you again and again!

16216.「なんだ これは……？\n この ぬいぐるみが 今の魔物の……\n スピンドルの:
What is this...? Was this stuffed animal the
true identity of the monster Spindle?

16217.「ワケが わからぬことばかりだが……\n とにかく 城に戻るとしよう。\n お前:
I don't know what's going on, but I'm going
back to the castle. I have to thank you for
your hospitality.

16218.グロスナー王は 気絶していた\nマグナスと リッグを 起こすと\nひと足先に ガ:
King Grossner woke Magnus and Rigg, who had
fainted, and returned to Gartlant Castle one
step ahead of them.

16219.「よく戻ってくれた <pc>。\n じつは 奇妙な事態に なっておってな。\n:
Welcome back <pc>. Actually, there's
been a strange situation. I must confess I'm a
bit confused myself...

16220.「とにかく まずは 今回のはたらきに\n 報いねばな。:
Anyway, first of all, I have to reward him for
his work this time.

16221.「お前さんのおかげで スパイが判明した。\n 礼を言うぞ <pc>。\n 心ばか:
Thanks to you, we have identified the spy. I
thank you, <pc>. It's a little
something from the heart, but take this!

16222.「さて それでは 何が起こっているのか \n 説明したいのじゃが……\n ううむ:
Now then, I'd like to explain what's going
on...hmmm. What can I say?

16223.「じつはな。お前さんが 倒したはずの\n スピンドルが どういうわけか\n つい:
As a matter of fact. The Spindle that you were
supposed to have defeated was somehow found in
the castle a short while ago.

16224.「あやつの部屋に 掃除に入った侍女が\n 気を失って 倒れているスピンドルを\n:
A maid's room was being cleaned when she found
Spindle lying unconscious in the floor.

16225.「しかも 部屋に置いてあった人形が\n 急に スピンドルの姿に変わったという\n:
And it's hard to believe that the doll in the
room suddenly turned into him...

16226.「スピンドルが 意識を取り戻したら\n こちらに 連行する手はずです。\n どう:
We will bring Spindle in when he regains
consciousness. Please join us, <pc>.

16227.しばらくして スピンドル兵士長が\n玉座の間に 連行されてきた。:
A short time later, Captain Spindle was
brought into the throne Room.

16228.「……では そのチョコ神ぬいぐるみという人形が\n 突然 お前の姿に変身して 逆:
So you're saying that this Choco-God Plushie suddenly transformed into you, and you, in turn, were transformed into the doll? Is that
right?

16229.「まことに 面目次第もございませんが\n その通りでございます。:
I am truly sorry, but that is exactly what I
am saying.

16230.「すべては あの妖しき人形の仕業。\n この私が スパイとなって 陛下を……\n:
It was all the work of that bewitching puppet.
It is not possible for me, a spy, to betray
Your Majesty and Gartlant!

16231.「にわかには 信じがたい話じゃが わしも\n <pc>も 魔物化したスピンドルが:
I know it's hard to believe, but both I and
<pc> have seen the demonized spindle
turn back into a puppet.

16232.「そもそも どんな バカげた話でも\n お前が わしを裏切ったという話よりは\n:
In the first place, any ridiculous story is
more credible than the story that you betrayed
me.

16234.「よく 無事に戻ってくれた スピンドル。\n これからも 変わらずに\n わしの:
Thank you for coming back safely, Spindle. You
will continue to work for me as my one hand!

16235.「なんと ありがたき お言葉……\n このスピンドル 感激にたえませぬ。:
Thank you very much for your kind words...
I am truly moved.

16236.「……しかしながら グロスナー王。\n それでは 私が 自分自身を許せませぬ。\:
...But, King Grossner. Then I cannot forgive
myself. I beg you to place me under house
arrest.

16237.「……ふむ。お前が 望むなら 仕方ない。\n だが 罰としてではなく あくまで\:
Hmm. If you want, I have no choice. But not as
a punishment, but as a period of recuperation,
I'll give you some time off!

16238.「慈悲深き お心づかい 感謝いたします。\n では 私は これにて……。:
Thank you for your compassionate concern. Now,
if you'll excuse me...

16239.「聞いての通りだ。\n 我らの敵は 妖しげな術を使って\n スパイを送り込む 卑:
As you have heard. Our enemies seem to be a
bunch of scoundrels who send their spies to
spy on us through some mysterious means.

16240.「これ以上 ヤツらの勝手にはさせぬ！\n ガズバランの牙よ \n 今度こそ 目に:
I will not let them have their way any longer!
Gazbalan's Fang, let us show them what we can
do this time!

28573.「さすが <pc>は 話がわかるな。\n もし マグナスなんぞに打ち明けたら\n:
As expected of <pc>, he knows what
he's talking about. If I had confided in
Magnus, he would have stopped me for sure.

28574.「……っと そろそろ マグナスたちが\n スピンドルを連れて 戻ってくるはず。\:
Oh well, Magnus and the others should be back
soon with Spindle. You go on ahead!

28575.「その返事は うれしく思うが……\n どうやら お前さん \n 予定が いっぱい:
I'm glad to hear that, but it seems you have a
full schedule.

28576.「よし。作戦開始は しばらく待とう。\n お前さんは 早く 頼まれごとを\n 片:
Okay. Let's wait a while for the operation to
start. You, quickly, go and take care of that
favor I asked you to do.

28577.「グロスナー王。\n スピンドル兵士長は 自室にいませんでした。\n どうやら:
King Grossner. Captain Spindle was not in his
room. Apparently, he was out on a patrol.

28578.「どうしましょう？ \n 城下町のどこかには いるでしょうから\n 人を使って:
What should we do? Should we send someone to
look for him?

28579.「……ああ もういいぞ。\n とりあえず その件は 先送りだ。\n ご苦労だった:
Oh, that's enough. Let's put that behind us
for now. Thank you, Magnus.

28581.「今は タイミングではないということか。\n しかし わしは あきらめるつもりは:
So this is not the right time. But I have no
intention of giving up.

28582.「もし 気が変わったら すぐ わしに\n 声をかけてくれ。:
If you change your mind, call on me
immediately.

28583.「グロスナー王。\n スピンドル兵士長は 自室にいませんでした。\n どうやら:
King Grossner. Captain Spindle was not in his
room. Apparently, he was out on a patrol.

28584.「どうしましょう？ \n 城下町のどこかには いるでしょうから\n 人を使って:
What should we do? Should we send someone to
look for him?

28585.「……ああ もういいぞ。\n とりあえず その件は 先送りだ。\n ご苦労だった:
Oh, that's enough. Let's put that behind us
for now. Thank you, Magnus.
